cards.title: India Gate
cards.content: The India Gate is a war memorial located near the Kartavya path on the eastern edge of the ceremonial axis of New Delhi.

cards.title: Red Fort
cards.content: The Red Fort Complex was built as the palace fort of Shahjahanabad.

cards.title: Akshardham
cards.content: Swaminarayan Akshardham is one of the most popular Hindu temples in India.

cards.title: Lotus Temple
cards.content: The Lotus Temple, located in Delhi, India, is a Bahá'í House of Worship that was dedicated in December 1986, costing $10 million.

cards.title: Jama Masjid
cards.content: One of the largest mosques in India, Jama Masjid is situated in Old Delhi.

cards.title: Rashtrapati Bhavan
cards.content: Rashtrapati Bhavan is a house of four floors and has some 340 rooms of varying sizes.

cards.title: Jantar Mantar
cards.content: Jantar Mantar is a testament of the architectural brilliance and astronomical innovations of the Rajput era.

cards.title: Rajghat
cards.content: Raj Ghat is a memorial in Delhi where Mahatma Gandhi, the Father of the Nation.

cards.title: Dilli Haat
cards.content: Dilli Haat has been designed in the traditional north Indian architectural style in brick latticework and stone roofs.

cards.title: Qutab Minar
cards.content: The height of Qutb Minar is 72.5 meters, making it the tallest minaret in the world built of bricks.
